item.title: Linux SSH Session Management for Network Engineers
item.description: A few weeks ago I bought myself a new Dell XPS-13 and decided for the n-th time to go all-in Linux, that is to have Linux as the main and only laptop OS. Since most of my Linux experience is with Fedora-family distros, I quickly installed Fedora-25 and embarked on a long and painful journey of getting out of my Windows comfort zone and re-establishing it in Linux. One of the most important aspects for me, as a network engineer, is to have a streamlined process of accessing network devices.
